meanings.definition: To start or cause something to start quickly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She kickstarts her day with a healthy breakfast every morning.
meanings.sent2: The coach kickstarts the team's motivation with a powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: His alarm clock kickstarts his day whether he likes it or not.
meanings.sent4: The new project kickstarts a wave of creativity in the office.
meanings.sent5: The engine kickstarts with a loud roar, ready to go.

meanings.definition: A sudden and energetic start or boost.
meanings.sent1: The concert had a kickstarts with an exciting opening act.
meanings.sent2: A cup of coffee in the morning is the perfect kickstarts for her day.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain was a kickstarts to their outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: The surprise announcement gave a kickstarts to the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The applause from the audience was the kickstarts the performer needed.
